intro: Pseudolysimachion komarovii, commonly known as the Komarov's pseudolysimachion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate to cold climates. It is often found in alpine environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
